import React, { useState, useContext, useEffect } from 'react' import "./styles.css" import menuContext from '../context/menuContext'; const Menu = () => { const { addMenu } = useContext(menuContext); const [menu, setMenu] = useState({ name: "", category: "", menus: "", description: "" }) const [menuData, setMenuData] = useState([]); // State to store the fetched data const categories = ["Chinese", "Italian", "Indian", "Beverages"]; const [selectedCategory, setSelectedCategory] = useState(""); // State for the selected category useEffect(() => { // Fetch data from the API endpoint when the component mounts fetch('/api/menuData/addmenu') .then(response => response.json()) .then(data => setMenuData(data)) .catch(error => console.error('Error fetching data:', error)); }, []); // The empty dependency array ensures this effect runs only once const handleCategorySelect = (category) => { setSelectedCategory(category); setMenu({ ...menu, category }); // Update the category in the menu state } const handleClick = (e) => { e.preventDefault(); addMenu(menu.name, selectedCategory, menu.menus, menu.description); setMenu({ name: "", category: "", menus: "", description: "" }); } const onChange = (e) => { const { name, value } = e.target; setMenu({ ...menu, [name]: value }); } return (

Add New Category

) } export default Menu
